metadata.title: POST 30 15

config.question: What impact did the cultural rebellion of the 1960s have on mainstream society?

choices.content: Many people in mainstream society adopted the clothing and hairstyles of the counterculture movement.
Most young adults in mainstream society turned away from the counterculture movement to embrace traditional values.
The counterculture movement was applauded by ethnic groups, but was largely rejected among mainstream society.
The counterculture movement appealed to adolescents, but held no interest for adults in mainstream society.

answer_3.response: Led by college students, young people challenged the prevailing adult values in clothing, hairstyles, sexual conduct, work, and music. Blue jeans and love beads replaced business suits and wristwatches; long hair and unkempt beards for men, bare feet and bralessness for women became a uniform of protest.
